description:
Log ERROR or TRACE messages are not allowed in nova-conductor. This one has been observed in this gate job:


http://logs.openstack.org/11/89211/22/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/dfa4541/logs/screen-n-cond.txt.gz?level=TRACE
title: db deadlock in nova-conductor

comments.content:
Log ERROR or TRACE messages are not allowed in nova-conductor. This one has been observed in this gate job:


http://logs.openstack.org/11/89211/22/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/dfa4541/logs/screen-n-cond.txt.gz?level=TRACE
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~armando-migliaccio

comments.content:
I think this is fixed.  I suspect it may have gone away with the latest release of oslo.db.  I'm asking Mike Bayer to help confirm.

This method has the @_retry_on_deadlock decorator on it, but the older db code didn't catch all cases and convert them to the DBDeadlock exception.  The oslo.db changes were more broad than that, but that's the particular issue here.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content:
as of oslo.db 0.4.0 there's a new system of intercepting exceptions that catches them in all cases, as it works as a core event handler where SQLAlchemy is actually producing this error.

I see the stack trace here was created on 8/30 and per https://pypi.python.org/pypi/oslo.db/0.4.0 0.4.0 was released on 8/20, however I think Nova wasn't using oslo.db directly for database connectivity at that time?  (e.g. it still had the copied oslo-incubator code).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zzzeek

comments.content: Confusingly, nova requires oslo.db and no longer imports via "managed cut and paste" that code. I think this bug is therefore resolved.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikal
